item.title: Mario Kart World Player Gets Hit by Blue Shell at the Worst Possible Time
item.description:
While playing Mario Kart World , a player was hit by a Blue Shell at the worst possible time, causing them to fall behind in their race. Mario Kart World brings back many classic series items, including the Blue Shell, resulting in some hilarious albeit unfortunate clips for racers.

As the big first-party launch title for the Nintendo Switch 2, Mario Kart World has received a lot of attention for its innovations made to the racing series. Among the new features, the game added Free Roam and Knockout Tour modes, providing players with alternatives to classics like Grand Prix. Even Grand Prix was reworked, with players now traveling to the courses at the start of a race. With numerous players checking out the game and its new mechanics, many clips have been shared online.

As spotted by Dexerto, one of these clips came from a Reddit user known as TheIronicTea and involved the infamous Blue Shell in Mario Kart World . The clip took place on the Bowser’s Castle course as the player was in the lead using Stingby. As TheIronicTea was about to head up a boost ramp, they received the notification that a Blue Shell was tracking them. Unfortunately, the item detonated on the player just before they reached the top of the ramp. This resulted in them losing all their momentum. The situation was worsened by the steep incline, causing the kart to be unable to make forward progress. Eventually, the racer decided to go into reverse, allowing them to run over a boost pad and continue through the course. However, when all was said and done, they had dropped to 12th position.

Mario Kart World Player Struggles to Recover After Being Hit by Blue Shell

This Blue Shell clip caught the attention of many fans on the Mario Kart subreddit. So far, several hundred users have upvoted the post, commenting on TheIronicTea’s misfortune. While the item is designed to keep first-place drivers from gaining too much of a lead in a race, some players think it can be unfair. It is worth noting that Mario Kart World does have several ways of countering Blue Shells. Specifically, players can use a carefully timed Mushroom to dodge the explosion, and the Super Horn can destroy it.

It will be interesting to see what other clips are shared with the community in the weeks ahead as players discover more techniques. Following the launch of the Switch 2, Mario Kart World was the best-selling game for the new console. While Nintendo has more Switch 2 exclusive games on the horizon, including Donkey Kong Bananza , the online component to Mario Kart World likely means players will continue to play the racing game for the foreseeable future.

Hit the open road with Mario and friends! Zip around courses in a vast world where everything is connected. Race along grassy plains, bustling cities, wide-open waters, big ol' volcanos, and more—plus everything in between.

A sprawling world of courses. Speed across plains, cities, water, volcanos, and much more. Everything is connected!

Go beyond the course. There's more to racing than just the course. Hop off the course and race the distance to the next one!

Free Roam - Drive wherever your heart takes you. Where to? That's up to you! Take off in any direction in this new mode. Explore areas that pique your interest, and maybe even snap some in-game pics at scenic spots.

Play Together - Have a blast with friends, whether near or far. Up to 4 players can race on the same system. Play using your choice of button controls or motion controls. Attach a Joy-Con 2 controller to the optional Joy-Con 2 wheel accessory to wheely feel like you're driving. You can also play using Nintendo Switch Joy-Con controllers connected wirelessly.

item.title: Minecraft Player Discovers Ocean Monument in Unusual Location
item.description:
A Minecraft player happened across an ocean monument that seems to have spawned in a particularly unusual location, planted directly beneath a floating desert biome. The massively popular sandbox game from Mojang features plenty of hidden secrets for players to uncover in their worlds, both above ground and deep within its depths. Players can happen across everything from temples in different biomes and Pillager Outposts to winding mine shafts and underground Fortresses. However, one player's Minecraft discovery serves as a bit more of an unusual oddity than the game's normal structures.

First added in 2014's "Bountiful Update," ocean monuments give players something to discover beneath the oceans in their Minecraft worlds. Ocean monuments feature several different rooms for players to explore, typically protected by Guardians and a pre-determined number of Elder Guardians. Players can track down ocean monuments within their worlds by using ocean explorer maps obtained from Cartographer Villagers, with players able to find Gold and Prismarine blocks within. A Minecraft player is now sharing their unusual run-in with one of the sub-aquatic structures.

A post shared to the Minecraft subreddit by Reddit user Neffdigitydog shows off the unusual spawn point for an ocean monument in their world. The underwater monument appears to have spawned directly beneath a desert biome within the game, featuring sand blocks suspended in mid-air directly above the monument. The user points out the spawn as particularly odd as ocean monuments only spawn in ocean biomes, suggesting Minecraft had assigned two different biomes to the same location. The player also shares both the seed for the Minecraft world and some key coordinates in the replies.

Minecraft Fan Finds Ocean Monument Under Desert

Replies from other Minecraft fans saw a mixture of players trying to deduce how the unusual spawn had occurred. The most prevalent theory about the strange structure posited that Minecraft had attempted to spawn a monument at the edge of an ocean biome, causing it to overlap with the neighboring Desert biome. Other fans posited that the monument might have been generated in an older world, though the original poster did point out the world was created no older than the 1.20 update. One fan jokingly suggested the user should break a sand block, causing the others to drop into the ocean.

Minecraft has seen some big updates in recent months, making a plethora of major changes to the beloved game. Mojang officially unveiled Minecraft 's new "Vibrant Visuals" update earlier this year, making sweeping overhauls to the game's graphics engine and introducing improved water shading, volumetric lighting, and plenty more. Minecraft will also soon launch its "Chase the Skies" update, officially introducing Happy Ghasts to the game alongside finally allowing players to craft saddles. Minecraft 's upgraded graphics and new content should look to give fans plenty more to do in its sandbox world.

item.title: No, I'm Not a Human: All Visitors
item.description:
Despite the fact that No, I'm Not a Human is only available as a demo, it has already managed to gather quite a large fan base. This is not surprising since this horror game allows you to experience a paranoid nightmare in which every person can be your enemy.

Visitors are dangerous creatures that disguise themselves as people and try to trick their way into the homes of ordinary people; at least that is what local television says. However, the threat is real, and it is up to you to choose who to let in. For those unsure, here's a detailed look at all the visitors in No, I'm Not a Human .

Who Are the Visitors in No, I'm Not a Human?

The main task of players in No, I'm Not a Human is to survive during the coming apocalypse caused by solar flares. However, the extremely high temperature outside during the day is far from the most serious problem; at the same time, visitors have begun to appear in the world. They often look and act like people, but they desire to kill.

At the time of writing, we still know little about these visitors. Are they really creatures different from humans, or are they just people who have gone crazy from the heat?

From the news on TV, players learn that visitors are digging out of the ground where they supposedly lived for a long time. As a result, they have dirt under their nails and bloodshot eyes from the light. However, it is difficult to call them creatures imitating people because some of them quite clearly remember their lives, from which it can be assumed that the visitors were once people. In any case, they pose a threat to No, I'm Not a Human players, so it is better to not let them into one's house.

How to Distinguish Between All Visitors in No, I'm Not a Human

The 2025 demo added randomization to the game, so it is now much more difficult for players to find visitors among ordinary people. Therefore, most of the time, you will let guests into the house at night and check them during the day for signs of visitors, such as:

  • Perfect white teeth
  • Dirty fingernails
  • Bloodshot eyes
  • Blurred photos
  • Hairless armpits

It is worth noting that blurred photos as a sign were available in the 2024 demo. In the new No, I'm Not a Human Steam Next Fest demo, however, this has been replaced by hairless armpits. Through these seemingly insignificant signs, you will have to figure out who is an enemy and who is not. Luckily, some guests always have fixed roles:

  • Tall man - Human
  • Cashier girl - Visitor
  • Neighbor’s daughter - Human
  • Fireman - Human
  • Amogus man - Visitor
  • Twin sisters - Human

The rest of the guests could be either a visitor or a human, so be sure to check their teeth, eyes, hands, etc. This is the only way to find out who is under your roof in No, I'm Not a Human .

item.title: World of Warcraft's 11.1.7 Patch May Be Letting The Genie Out of the Bottle
item.description:
There are many reasons why World of Warcraft players should keep an eye on patch 11.1.7, coming in just a couple of days now, as it will bring many new additions, some extra content, and even a handful of cosmetics to collect. From the new Lorewalking feature to Overcharged Delves, from the Recuperate healing skill available to all classes to the return of the Greedy Emissary in World of Warcraft , patch 11.1.7 is filled to the brim, even if not all its content will drop immediately on June 17. Among these new additions are also two big features that may create a new path for the game that Blizzard may no longer be able to ignore.

Not everything that is coming with patch 11.1.7 for World of Warcraft is going to sit well with all players, though. For example, based on datamines, it's likely that some cosmetics from the new Banshee collection may be paid only, whereas others are supposedly coming to the Trading Post. With four different color variations of the armor set, mounts, and weapons, this seems the most plausible outcome. More importantly, patch 11.1.7 will add the one-button DPS feature alongside the new combat assistant, and both are about to facilitate combat and rotation for all players who use them, even if the DPS may not be as competitive. This sets the stage for Blizzard to grant a longtime wish, though.

World of Warcraft's 11.1.7 Update Opens a Pandora's Box The Game Can't Close

Some players are unhappy about the addition of one-button DPS and combat assistant (Single-Button Assistant and Assisted Highlight, officially) due to how this could affect runs in high-end content, such as Raids or Mythic+ Dungeons in World of Warcraft , which instead require better DPS numbers than the assistant or one-button systems can provide. Still, it's a major win for accessibility, making the game more easily playable for all kinds of players. Not only that, but this could be the definitive sign that Blizzard is preparing for a World of Warcraft port on consoles.

World of Warcraft on consoles has long been requested by the community, given the game's appeal, its long history in the industry, the Warcraft games that came before it, the spin-off projects that came after, like Hearthstone , and more. One could make a case that this is not a sign for WoW on consoles because Final Fantasy 14 already is on consoles, and it may have similar rotation-based gameplay, so if that game is fine on controller, WoW can be too. This makes sense, but Blizzard has been adding more and more accessibility features that make the game easier to get into or return to over time.

An example is World of Warcraft's Timewalking, so both new and returning players, as well as veterans, can get some form of progression on their characters by experiencing past expansions.

Both World of Warcraft 's one-button DPS function and the new combat assistant would arguably make it much easier to play the game on console, given the limited number of buttons one can press there, so it does feel like a big step in that direction. Even if this is not the plan, it's something Blizzard should consider due to how much demand there has been over the years for WoW 's console port.

World of Warcraft May Be Setting Up an Xbox-Exclusive Console Port

There is also a non-zero chance that the highly requested World of Warcraft console port will be an Xbox exclusive, at least in the beginning. This is because Blizzard has been acquired by Microsoft, and there's the upcoming ROG Xbox Ally handheld console, so it would make sense to promote a World of Warcraft port on Xbox there, too. One-button DPS would make playing WoW on console extremely smoother, even if it means missing out on some of the more competitive activities in the game, but it would be a dream come true for many players and potential fans out there. It remains to be seen whether this will be the case, but it would make perfect sense.

This feature applies to World of Warcraft retail, but if Blizzard were to pull a console port, it could eventually come to WoW Classic as well.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden Fans Are Disappointed With Ryu's Treatment in Recent Releases
item.description:
Ninja Gaiden fans are disappointed with series protagonist Ryu Hayabusa's treatment in the franchise's latest entries, including the upcoming Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound game from Dotemu and The Game Kitchen. 2025 is a very notable year for the Ninja Gaiden franchise, as Koei Tecmo dubs it the "Year of the Ninja," thanks to multiple new releases for the series.

During Microsoft's Xbox Developer Direct in January 2025, Koei Tecmo, Team Ninja and PlatinumGames surprised Ninja Gaiden fans with the reveal of Ninja Gaiden 4 , which stars the new protagonist Yakumo from the Raven clan alongside Ryu. Although Ninja Gaiden 4 is planned for release on October 21, fans still have plenty of Ninja Gaiden games to enjoy before the fourth numbered title's release. These games include the already released Ninja Gaiden 2 Black and the upcoming Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound , with the latter launching on July 31 for PC and consoles. However, fans aren't happy with how Koei Tecmo and Team Ninja have treated the franchise's iconic protagonist over the past decade leading up to Ninja Gaiden 4's release later this year.

Reddit user ThatSharkFromJaws is not happy with the past three installments of Ninja Gaiden featuring Ryu as a side character instead of a central protagonist. Most notably, ThatSharkFromJaws and other Ninja Gaiden fans trace Ryu's treatment as a side character back to 2014's Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z , which starred the titular protagonist Yaiba. Following the release of Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z , the Ninja Gaiden franchise took a considerable hiatus until the release of Ninja Gaiden: Master Collection in 2021, followed by the release of Ninja Gaiden 2 Black in 2025. Both of these titles offer definitive versions of Ryu's games, but fans are upset and frustrated that Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound doesn't appear to focus on Ryu after nearly a decade without all-new Ninja Gaiden games. Others aren't pleased that Ninja Gaiden 4 could potentially place most of its focus on Yakumo, despite Ryu being one of the game's two protagonists.

Ninja Gaiden Fans Aren't Happy About Ryu Hayabusa Being a Side Character in the Franchise's Releases Over the Years

  • Some Ninja Gaiden fans are disappointed that Ryu has not been the main character in some of the franchise's most recent entries, including Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z and Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound .
  • A few fans worry that Ninja Gaiden 4 may focus more on Yakumo instead of Ryu, while others are hopeful about Ryu's involvement.

However, some Ninja Gaiden fans, including Reddit users Arandui and PotatoIceCreem, aren't as disappointed with Ryu's absence from the spotlight over the years. Some Reddit users believe Ninja Gaiden games like Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound and Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z should experiment with new protagonists and different gameplay mechanics compared to the mainline entries. A few fans are still cautious about Ninja Gaiden 4 , with some drawing comparisons with Devil May Cry 4 , which featured protagonist Nero instead of Dante in roughly over half of the game's story missions.

At the very least, Ninja Gaiden 4 seems prepped to offer a lot of engaging levels and content to explore while playing as Yakumo and Ryu. Ninja Gaiden 4 is an Xbox Game Pass day one title, so subscribers will have immediate access on launch day to see what the new action game has in store for fans.
